intro: Dirichletia sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed dirichletia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, showy flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
